snippet: STUART--Shaw. Sculptor/art teacher. Shaw Stuart was a sculptor for more than 40 years. Her creations won numerous awards in local and national competitions. She was a visiting artist at Weir Farm National Historic Site. She built a 13-foot stone tower on the grounds of the Stamford Museum, part of their permanent collection. Shaw graduated from Syracuse University at the top of her class and was crowned Miss Syracuse. Shaw Stuart was 86 when she died peacefully in Greenwich, CT on April 2nd, the birthday of her twin granddaughters. She is survived by her son Preston Stuart and three grandchildren, Miles, Ivy and Jillian. Her former husband, Richard A. Stuart, COO of American Home Products, and son Kent Stuart, a musician, predeceased her. 1/3
